newsitem.title: USA: Muni bond volume drops nine pct in Q1 1997 -- SDC.
newsitem.headline: Muni bond volume drops nine pct in Q1 1997 -- SDC.

text.p: Municipal bond volume dropped nine percent to $37.4 billion in first quarter 1997 from first quarter 1996, Securities Data Co said Monday.
The decline was a 29.7 percent drop from the $53.2 billion of municipal bonds sold in fourth quarter 1996, according to Securities Data.
Smith Barney Inc, a unit of Travelers Group Inc, was the top-ranked underwriter during the quarter, acting as senior manager for 99 issues totaling $5.4 billion.

Goldman Sachs & Co, the previous top-ranked underwriter, dropped to third with $3.7 billion and 48 deals. Securities Data said PaineWebber Inc, a unit of PaineWebber Group Inc, was second with $4.1 billion and 66 issues.
Merrill Lynch & Co, traditionally among the top muni underwriters, fell to fifth place for the first quarter with $2.7 billion and 60 issues.

Orrick, Herrington & Sutcliffe was the top bond counsel for the quarter with 54 issues totaling $3 billion to its credit. Public Resources Advisory Group had the most volume among financial advisers, with $3.3 billion and 19 issues.
